author: Shoko Karakilic
text: 'Korean lady who appears to be the owner just kicked me out of the restaurant bc my baby was crying. Unbelievable. Staff witnessed it too and was in awe.'

author: Bree Garcia
text: 'Very cute spot to do work and eat! Great location
column5: staff
column6: and food!! Love the grilled chicken sandwich'

author: Yolo's LetsPlays
text: 'Great quality food
column5: service'

author: Rucha Patil
text: 'Everything was very tasty'

author: Mina Penna
text: 'We have been coming to Tostis for years and have been so happy here. We love the casual atmosphere yet delicious food. I don’t think we’ve tried anything that we haven’t liked. The help has always been so kind and particularly wonderful with our two young
column5: high energy boys!  I highly recommend coming here!'

author: Vashist Krishna
text: "Decent food
column5: value for money isn't as good."

author: Josh Rajasansi
text: 'I had the tomato soup and the Turmeric Tuna sandwich with fries. Deanna recommend the fries and they were very good. The soup came out HOT which I love and was exceptionally delicious. It’s cream based and may not always be available. The sandwich was made with very high quality ingredients and was fresh and delicious with just the right amount of heat. And the service was great! Very quaint and casual place. A perfect lunch!'

author: Sol Raff
text: '(Translated by Google) Not only is the place beautiful with a super picturesque view
column5: the workers are super friendly and attentive
column6:
but the food is extremely delicious.

(Original)
No sólo el lugar es hermoso con una vista súper pintoresca
column7: los trabajadores son súper amables y atentos
column8: sino que la comida es extremadamente rica.'

author: Janani Raman
text: 'Lovely cafe with lot of options for breakfast/ brunch and very courteous staff. Cozy spot for Sunday mornings!'

author: sanjay ramanathan
text: 'Lovely place. Courteous staff. Elaborate for a diner'

author: Immanuel Gregory
text: 'Quite the experience
column5: though a little unorganized.\n-\nSpending some time in NJ
column6: we decided to hit up Tosti which seems to be a Breakfast/Lunch hybrid restaurant. I\'d like to talk about the service more than anything. The servers are a mixed bag of fun; some are very lively and others are very polite. I could only spot a couple of long faces which is understandable
column7: they get a good bit of service so a smile isn\'t always affordable.\nI couldn\'t catch the names of them but I want there was a asian lady dressed in red who was great at making the environment feel particularly welcome
column8: many thanks to you.. whoever you are.\n\nAn odd situation that keeps the rating lower is that they not only forgot an order
column9: but were unable to split a check. I won\'t fault them for it though
column10: but it seems like "splitting the check" isn\'t a common concept - if it is.. I have no clue why it caused so much confusion.\n\nThe food was really good
column11: I especially enjoyed their French Fries and Tosti Burger\nI recommend this spot

author: Mateo
text: 'Best breakfast sandwich I’ve ever had.'

author: iris luna
text: 'Very good coffee and great service\nHuevos rancheros was amazing'

author: David Torres
text: 'Nice place for breakfast
column5: huevos rancheros are my favorites.'

author: Sara Yanna
text: 'Good service and good food!!'

author: Natalie Koima
text: 'Linda was amazing such an awesome server!!\nShe knew exactly what I wanted by a brief description.'

author: karen eren
text: 'I had a lower star review before due to previous management. I believe they have changed it and the new people were much nicer. Food is great. The server was very friendly and attentive. Will come back again'

author: Silvia Rodrigues
text: 'Very good turmeric tuna sandwich'

author: Kenneth Ong
text: 'I like the tuna sandwich i ordered. It is well put together. Server is responsive.  Restuarant manager goes around checking to make sure diners are comfortable and attended to. Looking forward to trying its shrimp chilli in the near future.'

author: X Boone (The FiG)
text: "Food was delightful
column5: subtract the covid restrictions and the indoor décor would be ideal for an enjoyable leisurely morning out with the misses. *warning* the prices are a bit absurd with the most gratitude given to the fact that there aren't any sides included in MOST orders."

author: Young K
text: 'Amazing foods (especially the fried chicken sandwich!) and the staff was very friendly.'

author: Crystal Serrano
text: 'Whither you want breakfast
column5: lunch
column6: brunch
column8: this is the place to go! Such a cute little spot for eating out and not super expensive at all. When going there I suggest getting anything on their sourdough
column9: any of the burgers (because of that SAUCE)
column10: or the waffles. Your portions are very reasonable. You’ll definitely leave full. :) The staff is adorable everyone is so friendly.'

author: Bianca Montoya
text: 'While the food is delicious
column5: the service is extremely horrible. Even my 12-year old niece was well aware of how the waitress treated us. The waitress never bothered to come back to our table to ask if we needed anything else
column6: such as napkins or more coffee. First time there
column7: and just may be our last.'

author: Fred Snyder
text: 'Just had another great meal at Tostis- great tasty food  at good prices. Friendly staff. Nice selection on menu- the new fried chicken sandwich is just delicious- they need to promote it more. I have not had a bad meal here (& doubt I will 😉). Owners
column5: Clair &Jimmy
column6: are great people.'

author: Michelle Gomez
text: 'Cute and cozy spot with tasty food and great service!'

author: Angelique Smith
text: 'While the food was very good
column5: the service was terrible. The waitresses seem very unenthused about serving and providing any sort of customer service. This sadly made my experience less exciting.'

author: EMAN ALOFI
text: 'I went there and I asked for cheese cake the waiter I think she is the owner gave me a really bad cheese cake it smells bad and it is really obvious it is an old cheese cake. I asked her politely to replace it for me and she was like why do you want to replace it I told her it seems not fresh and it has a bad smells. The waiter was like no it is just a fresh. I will never be back to this place. No respect No honesty towards customers..There is not even respect for me as a human being as I have a health I should have to take care of it.. ..Please be careful ..because it seems the owner she\nwants to get rid of the old cheese cake in the expenses of my health.. How rude she is ..  This place lacks credibility..It is okay for them to get rid of old sweets in the expenses of your health.. They never mind it.. .. Be careful..  I will never be there  bad experience.'

author: andre logan
text: 'Yes a little pricey but wow the food was good.'

author: Leslie Flores
text: 'Just had a Tosti Sandwhich and it was absolutely amazing. Everything was cooked to perfection. No complaints.'

author: Chris Shimmin
text: 'Great brunch spot. A good amount of outdoor seating.'

author: David Cove
text: 'I had a great lunch with a Friend here outside. Great spacious seating outside and tasty food.'

author: A F
text: 'Cute little spot for a simple lunch or breakfast. I had the TBLT and it was really good. Portion size to price is good value. Good variety of food too
column5: next time I’ll want to try something different'

author: Matthew Brooks
text: 'Very good food
column5: amazing service
column6: fair prices. Fresh OJ and home made jam (and bread?) was very nice.'

author: T V
text: 'Delicious food
column5: great service and good prices! Definitely a 5 star!'

author: Alyssa C
text: 'Really cute brunch spot! BYOB and the avocado toast was great when we went.'

author: Erika Vargas
text: 'Shrimp tacos are very good!'

author: Emily Ng
text: 'so good!'

author: FleeSwervinn
text: 'The manager Clare is rude and pays her workers below the wage pay. And I had diarrhea for a week after eating a chicken sandwich from there. STAY AWAY. The kitchen in the back is disgusting and the floors are sticky.'

author: Isaac Jafet Gonzalez Estevez
text: 'Good place to go to breakfast 👌'

author: Amanda Shirley
text: 'This place is great! Love the deviled avocado
column5: and French toast. The staff is nice
column6: too!'

author: MZ
text: 'I love the environment on the VIP section.. although it was a joke..it end up being perfect'

author: DH Kwon
text: 'Very nice food with healthy options. I love it.'

author: Warren Bedoya
text: 'Really excellent! Came here on a whim seeking Eggs Benedict and discovered the Honey Tumeric Latte which is so divine and puts you in such a good mood
column5: the eggs Benedict were refreshing with slice of tomato on top. Came back a few days later craving another Honey Tumeric Latte and ordered the chicken pot pie from the daily special menu and it was soo good
column6: this place is now one of our favorite spots now!'

author: Jodie Ordanza
text: 'Cute little spot we usually go to for brunch.'

author: Eszter Marossi
text: 'Great food
column5: very friendly service.'

author: Randolph Hoppe
text: 'Fresh
column5: tasty food!'

author: Frédérique MARIE NUÑEZ
text:
'(Translated by Google) Excellent Earl Gray Lavender tea. Very good for a casual brunch.

(Original)
Excellent thé Earl Grey Lavender. Très bien pour un brunch décontracté.'

author: Andrew G
text: 'Great
column5: friendly service and a really nice space
column6: but the food tastes like a teenager made it and the lattes taste like water. Sorry.'

author: William L
text: 'Fast service and friendly staff
column5: food is consistently good'

author: Suthida Chuenklin
text: "Good and fast service even though the place got busy and people lined up as the queue can be very long during brunch hours. I had avocado toast which was simply alright
column5: I've had much better at the other place in Hoboken. Hot latté was a bit heavy for some reason. I would come back here again to give it another go."

author: Anatoly Leskovets
text: 'Branch for the whole day'

author: Nando Speers
text: 'Excellent  place. 3pm Saturday it’s not crowded Mike our garçon was awesome and the sandwiches big
column5: delicious and very nice\nEndless coffee
column6: delicious coffee
column7: chocolate croissants were delicious !\nOnly good things about the place !\nFirst of many visits !!!'

author: Myles Helfand
text: "A Hoboken eatery WITH BISCUITS
column5: y'all. Made in house
column6: as are all of the pastries. Breakfast menu is just different enough to give this place its own niche in an increasingly dense breakfast/brunch-option area. The amazing croque madame (or its eggless male friend) is big enough for two."

author: Andrei Trifonov
text: 'Lovely place! Good food
column5: friendly atmosphere!'

author: Juan Manzano
text: 'This is a great place for  breakfast
column5: lunch
column6: brunch. They have a number of Gluten Free items on the menu. They have an outdoor seating area
column7: and the staff is very friendly and attentive.\n\nFood is great and  service excellent.'

author: joebar
text: 'Good menu for breakfast and lunch. Free refills on coffee! Bring your own beer. Outdoor seating. Super nice staff. (But no cold brew!). Is more casual than it looks. You can do work here or grab a bite with a friend.'

author: Dana Glossbrenner
text: 'Great lunch
column5: great service!'

author: Mia Naranjo
text: 'This place is really good. They’re willing to change things to your order if you just ask. The only thing that is a little bad is that they have modern food (stuff that is appealing to millennials and such) but they can change things to your order
column5: so it doesn’t really matter.'

author: Juliana Ohep
text: 'Very nice and great service happy we came'

author: Rodrigo Nogueira
text: 'Awesome place. Super friendly staff
column5: great sandwiches
column6: breakfast
column7: brunch and amazing waffle on weekends. Eat there many days a week. Plates are super customizable
column8: take/add mostly anything you want.\nChildren and dog friendly (there are usually both in the patio seating area).'

author: Kaitlyn Short
text: 'If I could give this 0 stars I would.\n\nLast week I went to tosti I ordered the farmers breakfast. The "biscuits" were more of a very dry roll and the gravy was like water. I am very picky about biscuits so I thought I just ordered the wrong thing because everything in all the pictures looks so good
column5: right?!\n\nToday I went back. I ordered a Belgian waffle and the person I was with ordered French toast (both side items). My water had a dead gnat in it and was warm because they just have glasses of water sitting in the corner to give you when you come in. We then proceeded to wait for 30 minutes ..... for a piece of toast and a waffle. Now
column6: I was a server for years and I understand the struggles. However
column7: our server never came to us to let us know what was going on. The tables to both sides of us got there after us
column9: paid and left and we were still waiting. I get up to ask someone and they said they would have it right out. Great! I sat back down and waited. 50 minutes later... still no food or server. I went to the counter and told them I would like to pay for my drink and just leave. They did not allow me to do that. Instead they brought an appetizer of fries to my table..... then a man (who I assume is the manager) comes over and told me they were having issues with the waffle maker... yet multiple people around me had been getting waffles.... then our server came up to us and said the kitchen was behind... also a lie because people who came after us had gotten their food and left. Our server finally brought out the food and it was not at all hot and the waffle was so bland. I mean
column10: when continental breakfast at a hotel has a better waffle then your restaurant you should probably just take it off the menu. this place had plenty of chances to make this right
column11: but did not. I\'m always very patient and understanding in restaurants because I know what it\'s like to be a server
column12: but I was absolutely livid. We got our bill and we had been charged for every item... you would think they would at least have taken something off for our wait... wouldn\'t you? This place is horribly managed. This is not how you treat customers. This place will not last here.'

author: Dillon Wu
text: 'Great cafe with friendly service!  Excellent veggie burger and fries. The Mac n Cheese appetizer was also really excellent!'

author: Russell Kriegel
text: 'Good fresh food.'

author: TJ Cheevers
text: 'Been here three or four times
column5: food & service is always excellent. Love the ambiance as well.'

author: Ali Kuemmer
text: 'Cute spot on Washington for breakfast/brunch/lunch. They serve breakfast all day which is nice. Cute atmosphere and friendly staff
column5: as well as a unique menu.'

author: DaFea Vinci
text: 'It is simple cafe
column5: nothing fancy except the prices. I make better coffee
column6: 10 years under the belt barista here ☕'

author: Brian Pearson
text: 'Pricey & pretentious - $15+ salads and nose-ring studded waitresses with an attitude and bad breath await you at this joint. Our waitress had breath that smelled like she was gargling with dumpster water flavored mouthwash then washing it out with stale crusted sploog scraped off her dirtbag boyfriends boxers. The French Toast is fabulous
column5: however - as are the hash browns and homemade jam. I left this place with a full stomach
column6: herpes and a hardon.\nEnough said.'

author: Maria Kuziw
text: 'Not “brunch” if you only serve breakfast foods until 12. 🙄'

author: Hen Pastry Chef
text: 'Lovely place
column5: quiet
column6: you can sit in and out. Excellent service!!'

author: David Wilson
text: 'This place is a great addition to Hoboken. Absolutely delicious food in a really charming
column5: relaxed cafe. The sandwiches are first rate and the tacos are really really good.\n\nAnd they have the best cheesecake in New Jersey!'

author: R S
text: 'Great brunch'

author: Sheri Mei
text: 'Very cute little cafe in uptown Hoboken. The iced coffee with oat milk was yummy! Would definitely love to come back and try their food.'

author: Erin Gill
text: 'Cute little restaurant in uptown hoboken. Everything is always fresh and service is great 👍'

author: Chris Markstrum
text: 'Food is really good. The coffee is excellent. Friendly owners and staff.'

author: LEON LEVY
text: 'Everything on the menu is delicious and the ambience is equally memorable!'

author: Ilya Margoulis
text: 'Worst experience we have ever had. We came as a family with 2 kids. Kids were having a snack and my wife was holding a coffee. I tried to order inside and  sit outside
column5: instead I was told to sit and wait for the waitress. Which is fine. The waitress came and looked at my kids like they were having lunch with food from another place and not having a snack. I tried to order waffle and coffee
column6: bit instead of taking my order I got - outside food is not allowed. And again - the look of "how dare you bring snack into our food temple". After that we just left...'

author: Anuj Mittal
text: 'Had tosti sandwich and huevos rancheros
column5: both were delicious'

author: Parth Soni
text: 'Good breakfast food and coffee options. Also
column5: the staff is cheerful and nice!'

author: peter brown
text: 'Tried it for lunch...cool spot
column5: good food and super friendly service.  Try the Avocado Toast.'

author: Regina Battino
text: 'A lovely relaxing atmosphere with delicious healthy food
column5: a great combination of ingredients and spices and reasonably priced. Very nice service as well. I am definitely coming back!'

author: Blanca Battino
text:
'Everything is fresh and delicious.  Many Vegan and non-vegan dishes  to choose from on their menu.
Their teas and freshly made desserts are really good.
We enjoyed this restaurant and we look forward to many more visits to Tosti.

The service is also excellent which makes it even a better experience.'

author: Sandy Gastil
text: 'Service was excellent! The prosciutto toast & biscuit sliders were yummy!   It was a short walk from Darhma suites! So glad we went there!!'

author: Brittany C.
text: "Pricey for brunch
column5: especially since you don't get sides included (for most?). Food is pretty good though and the look is very cute."

author: Thomas Schonig
text: 'A nice spot - good service and ambiance
column5: with tasty and reasonably priced food. Steak and eggs recommended.'

author: Ibrahim Basha
text: 'Friendly staff and good service'

author: Brian Tice
text: "We love this place.  I've had avocado toast
column5: burger
column6: salads
column8: coffees - they are all great!  Faster
column10: and more delicious than other places in the area. Very fast for takeout but cozy to eat in.  Staff is always friendly and inviting."

author: Neetu Dalphus
text: 'Great place for a quick bite. Friendly staff and amazing food.'

author: Alex Ellick
text: "Charming French cafe in a super convenient spot. The food was delicious and the prices very reasonable. We came in at 10am on a Holiday and there was plenty of seating though it filled up quickly. The espresso was perfectly made and the service was prompt
column5: friendly and knowledgeable. The music was a mix of 1960s acoustic and French Jazz. If I lived in Hoboken I'd start my day here every day."

author: Ron Latz
text: 'If I could go here everyday for breakfast I would...'

author: Carlito Cabelin
text: 'Cordial staff
column5: cozy casual cafe style dinning
column6: baked goods supreme'

author: Nandini Sharma
text: 'Great choices for vegetarians and friendly staff.'

author: Ben Thomson
text: 'Amazing atmosphere with amazing food'

author: Sandeep H Das
text: 'Cosy place. Great coffee and snacks
column5: even better service. Would return.'

author: Corey Hoey
text: 'Terrible service and food that destroyed my stomach.'

author: morgane D
text: 'I love going there for a small bite and a cofee. The staff is also really nice
column5: great place !'

author: Kristina Schulz
text: 'I was instantly greeted with personable hospitality. The employees here are magnificent. I was treated so many times to surprises
column5: engaging conversations
column6: and caring actions. Phenomenal food and incredible coffee!!!!'

author: Nichole C
text: "Came here for breakfast on a Sunday morning. Casual atmosphere.  We dined here but it seems like you could also grab coffee and food to go.  Good service and the food came out quick.  Menu has a lot of options.  The lunch items such as salads
column5: sandwiches
column6: and burgers aren't served until after 12pm. I had the eggs benedict and my friend ordered the french toast both were very good.  The lattes didn't disappoint either.  It is byob too."

author: Christian Galanti
text: 'Great food. Service needs work'

author: Chuck Mound
text: 'Stopped on for a quick espresso. A little pricey for a double shot at 3.25
column5: but have no problem paying more for a great shot of espresso and it met the gold standard. So much better than a Dunkin donuts or Starbucks. Looked like a move spot for lunch. I could only rate the espresso this visit.'

author: Aaron Beveridge
text: "Would be much higher... I like this place and their food... But I order the Hummus Salad - it's very good and really should have feta cheese in it (in my opinion). When I ask to add it
column5: they charge another $3 for a very small amount - bringing the price up to almost $17 for a fairly small salad. Ridiculous"

author: Ms. W
text: 'Well I was celebrating being employee of the month and came here to get breakfast for myself and two colleagues. It was the breakfast menu that caught my attention
column5: different than the norm yet still identifiable for people who like classic breakfast. I had the biscuits sliders
column6: my colleagues ordered the bacon eggs and cheese croissant and the avocado toast breakfast. Also I ordered a side of links french toast
column8: and coffee. The staff was welcoming and polite
column9: 5 stars for customer service. As I waited for my order I took some pics of the quaint
column11: yet cozy atmosphere. The food is very
column16: eye pleasing and most importantly flavorful yet not overdone my sliders came with a well made raspberry jam. I tried the avocado toast and it was soooo soooo good. The french toast was good as well yet for my taste a little on the dry side
column17: it was served beautifully with fresh cut strawberries. The price is very fair for the quality and satisfaction you will feel from eating here and I look forward to trying the other meals on their menu.'

author: Cayce Connolly
text: 'Great food. Friendly service. Chill atmosphere.'

author: Jack Mello
text: 'nice people
column5: good food.'

author: Marina Mariy
text: 'Nice small place to come with kids. But they could add more healthy (gluten free) options'

author: Joe Brendel
text: 'Best dirty Chai in town and awesome chocolate chip cookies. Welcome addition to the hood'
